AzC has established a Capital Connectivity Portal at www.AzCollaboratory.org which provides access to a network of funding platforms working to solve two persistent problems: Funding Preparedness (companies seeking capital without adequate preparation or experience in securing capital) and the Funding Gap (capital between $1-10 million).http://www.AzCollaboratory.orgAzC is currently recruiting emerging growth companies, networks of service providers and investors.  As well, AzC is interested in connecting with registered Broker-Dealers in Arizona.

recommendations: Kerry Johnson
Healthcare and Patient Services Advocate
September 19, 2008, Kerry and Dan were students together

Time and space limit my chance to describe all the positive feelings I have about Dan Nienhauser.  It was a pleasure to have the opportunity to study with Dan at Arizona State University.  He is one of the most intelligent and articulate individuals that I have ever worked with.  Dan's ability to grasp the big picture and move past the minutia is a quality that I admire.  I worked directly with Dan on several key deliverables.  Dan works well in a team setting and has a personable communication style that fits in well in a diverse environment.  He is cool under pressure and delivers as promised.  It was a pleasure studying with Dan and I know that he will experience continued success as a business leader and educator.

Michael Klompus
Chief Human Resources Officer
April 10, 2008, Michael reported directly to Dan

Dan Nienhauser served as my direct supervisor for over 2 years while at The Earth Institute at Columbia University.  During that time, Dan was responsible for directing the financial planning of the Earth Institute, and supervised all administrative activities, including human resources, IT, and operations. Dan proved to be an outstanding supervisor and resource for me and the entire EI.  He took a unique approach to his position and demonstrated a strong entrepreneurial spirit.  Dan was highly respected for his intelligent and creative approach to resolving problems, and played a significant role in the success of the EI.   This was especially impressive considering the rapid grown the EI experienced during Dan’s tenure. As a supervisor, he truly had an “open door” policy, and made himself available to all his direct reports.  Overall, my experience in working for Dan was overwhelmingly positive, and I would highly recommend him for any position.
